text:
When running Tomcat 4.1.27 as an NT service, if you have a JSP that uses the 
<html:file> tag, Internet Explorer intermittently and frequently 
generates "Cannot find server" errors and does not submit the HTTP request. 
This occurs whether you're uploading a file or not. Just the fact that the 
<html:file> tag exists appears to cause the problem. If, however, Tomcat is 
started via the Start | Programs | Apache Tomcat 4.1 | Start Tomcat menu 
selection, IE does not have any problems and everything works fine. I am 
running MS Windows 2K Server, SP4 and have IE v6.0.2800.1106 with updates SP1, 
Q818529, Q330994, Q822925, Q828750, and Q824145. Thank you.
creator: ryan_peter@bah.com

text:
There are lots of components in the mix here: tomact, struts, IE, and the 
service wrapper.

From experience my money would be on the service wrapper or IE but this is 
purely a guess.

Answers to the following questions would be extremely helpful:
- What version of struts?
- Does it happen with the latest struts version?
- Does if happen with other browsers (eg Mozilla)?
- What happens with TC5 (it uses a different service wrapper)?
creator: markt@apache.org

text: No response after two months. Without information, this can't be investigated.
creator: markt@apache.org
